definition: to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.chinese: 那個人權紀錄不堪入目的人。

sentences.english: The press and her opponents would have a field day digging into the dirty details of her background.
sentences.chinese: 媒體和對手可以痛快地深挖她不堪入目的醜聞。

sentences.english: To begin with, the club itself is very unsightly.
sentences.chinese: 首先，這家夜總會本身就很不堪入目。

sentences.english: You know why most people have terrible resumes?
sentences.chinese: 你知道爲什麼許多人的簡歷不堪入目嗎？

sentences.english: I'm not easily shocked, but that book is really a bad one.
sentences.chinese: 我不會輕易感到震驚，但那實在是一本不堪入目的書。

sentences.english: Some articles in the magazine were intolerable to the eye.
sentences.chinese: 這家雜誌上的一些文章不堪入目。

sentences.english: More very person, will carry with this car goods, that is to enter order extremely really.
sentences.chinese: 更甚者，以這輛轎車來運貨，那真是不堪入目。

sentences.english: It’s unsightly to see food particles or grease on the rim of your glass.
sentences.chinese: 食物或油脂粘在玻璃杯邊緣都是不堪入目的。

definition: lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold
spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
to spoil one's appetite/fig. to get fed up with sth
lower course of a river/low-class/mean and lowly/vulgar/obscene
to have no sense of shame/brazen
